title: Radar Roundup: Don’t Miss the Velo Cosmos Show, Caletti Photo Show, Fish Ski 6-Pack, High Above Dyneema Hip Pack, Bullitt and Cinelli, Fat Tire and Dangle Supply, Trackers!, Bike Story Night with Alexandra Houchin, PEdALED Jary Collection 23, and Rémy Métailler Rides Portal
content:
Our Radar Roundup compiles products and videos from the ‘net in an easy-to-digest format. Read on below for today’s findings…

Dirty Sundays Velo Cosmos Show

Dirty Sundays is collaborating with the historic Holbrooke Hotel in Grass Valley, CA to organize a new exciting bicycle event that reflects the lifestyle and history of riding bikes in our community and around the world.

The event will dive into the past and share the evolution of bicycles with an exhibition of 40 bikes from different decades, all the way to modern hand-built custom bikes. There will be Vendors with bicycle-related artwork like jewelry, paintings, photography, etc.

Tom Ritchey and other industry legends will be attending and Tom himself will give a speech about the book of his mentor and friend, Jobst Brand. On Saturday and Sunday mornings there will be group rides that will take you around this scenic Victorian town and explore the past relics of Grass Valley’s rich mining history.

There will also be a swap meet outside with vintage and modern parts where you can possibly make some great deals!

Reel23Films will be filming during the whole event and preserve all the memories in a short video.

And of course, the Holbrooke Hotel will be offering awesome food and drinks in the oldest, continuously operating Hotel in California, and don’t miss the After-Party at the Iron Door bar downstairs!

See more at Dirty Sundays.

Caletti First Friday Photo Showcase

Santa Cruz and Bay Area folk, if you find yourself in the Caletti Cycles area on Friday, November 3rd, don’t miss out on this photo showcase. Caletti will have photos on display from Emily Bei Chang, Josh Becker, Christine La, and Chris Corona. It will be amazing. Revel in their visual storytelling! Santa Cruz Mountains Trail Stewardship will be there and they are bringing beverages. A food truck will be on site. Come on down and bring a friend.

Caletti Cycles
104 High Rd
Santa Cruz, CA 95060

Fish Ski Designs 6 Pack Carrier $80

Be it sparkling water, HopTea, canned wine, or beer, the newest from Fish Ski Designs is a 6-pack bevy carrier, handmade with love and care with durable materials. Built to ease the burden of carrying beverages on your bicycle. No need for a rack and basket here! The carrier attaches to your bike via velcro straps for the head tube and top tube to ensure safe n secure travel. Please travel responsibly and don’t ride drunk!

See more at Fish Ski Designs.

High Above The Astrotactics Dyneema Lookout 3 $170/$200

For nearly a decade, the Lookout has been the most popular pack High Above offers. Adaptable yet simple, the Lookout fits perfectly and offers a combination of fit that disappears behind you when worn with enough room to carry your gear for a day on the trails.

The Lookout is built to last with waterproof materials, invincible construction and smart, simple details. Available in a Quickdraw Bottle Package or a Bottle Rocket model.

Specs:

  • Dimensions: 9″ x 3″ x 5.25′” (LxWxH)
  • Waterproof and incredibly durable 5.0 oz Dyneema and Dimension Polyant aramid-reinforced fabric
  • Heavy-duty nylon webbing
    Three interior pockets
  • Additional weather-resistant external zippered pocket
  • YKK Aquaguard #8 zippers for unrivaled weatherproofing and durability
  • Extra-long para-cord zipper pulls for ease of entry
  • Domestically Made in Bellingham, Washington by hands that care.

Check out more at High Above.

 

Cinelli and Bullitt Vigorelli Limited Edition

Cinelli and Larry vs Harry are thrilled to announce a special collaboration of the Limited Edition Bullitt Vigorelli.

The Bullitt Vigorelli represents a high cultural impact collision of the two most beloved bikes by the world’s finest bike messengers: the Larry vs Harry Bullitt heavy-duty aluminum cargo bike and the Cinelli Vigorelli, iconic track bike of the 2000s.

 

﻿﻿﻿

 

Both these bikes have been ridden and raced by messengers across the world for almost twenty years, participating in an enormous transformation of the urban landscape. Finally the two beasts meet for a very limited special edition that pays homage to a shared history and culture!

See more at Larry vs. Harry.

Fat Tire and Dangle Supply

Fat Tire and Dangle Supply Company today announced the establishment of their Relaxation Research Department—a buzzworthy, joint collection of hard and soft goods crafted for the most elevated times – whether that’s high up on a mountaintop, or simply baking in the midday sun.

This stimulating capsule features both a co-branded DangleBong titanium water pipe and pocket-friendly Ti Cobb titanium pipe, along with a custom-printed proprietary Weird Wallet—an essential carrying kit for relaxation on the go. Additionally, Fat Tire and Dangle have released a limited run of apparel featuring custom-designed graphics from artist and fellow relaxation enthusiast Jason Sturgill.

See the full collection at Dangle Supply.

We Need to Talk About Trackers!

Over at the Stooge Cycles blog, there’s a great article on bicycle flat track racing, inspired by moto flat track. When we think of a coaster brake bike, most dirt-centric cyclists think Repack but this trackers thing was going on long before that.

Roll on over, foot out, to Stooge Cycles to read all about it!

 

Rad Bazaar Finds

We love seeing the support for our Rad Bazaar, a service we host to Group Ride Members. For now, you can read all about the Group Ride in our announcement post from last week until we work on an endemic landing page.

Velo Orange Neutrino rolling chassis, Pistachio, Large $1000

Velo Orange Neutrino Large Rolling Chassis. Excellent condition, no dents or noticeable scratches. Steer tube is cut down to only 40mm so you’ll need to use the included 70mm VO cigne stem, slam it, or use the steer tube extender included with the bike.

Blingy Sklar Super Something 48cm Honey Dijon $4850

Nearly new. Mint condition. Sklar Super Something White Industries Crank, BB, Hubs, Headset Paul Boxcar Stem, Clampers and Canti Brakes Dream Riser Bar Sram GX Eagle Cassette, Derailleur and Shifter Velocity Rims Teravail Cannondale 700×47 Tires Brooks saddle

Falconer All Road/Gravel Frame with Waterford Fork 54cm $1400

I had this bike built in 2016 by Cameron Falconer (@coffeeandeggs), and the fork built in 2020 by Waterford. A good, fast, classic all-rounder, perfect for everything from a gravel century to a cyclocross race, with all manner of daily riding in between. Ridden well with some wear to the finish, but straight with no dents. Selling this because I simply have too many gravel-ish drop bar bikes. Details: Light but sensible tubing, True Temper mix, TIG welded. Fender eyelets and three bottle mounts. Waterford brazed fork with mid-fork rack and fender eyelets, painted to match.

 

 

﻿﻿﻿

 

Bike Story Night Virtual Chat with Alexandra Houchin

In this virtual chat episode, Valerie from Bike Story Night chats with Alexandra Houchin, an Anishinaabekwe (Ojibwe woman) about her single-speed bike life, personal body journey, the upcoming 2023 Triple Crown, Chumba bikes, and her film “Stronger Together” which takes an intimate look into a story inspired by her mother’s journey to provide a good life for her and her siblings…

 

﻿﻿﻿

 

PEdALED Jary Collection – Fall Winter 23

Ride along with Marco Kesseler, a working photographer who moves throughout his busy days both on and off the bike. We met up with Marco recently for one of his photo explorations, where he took our latest Jary Collection of cross-over apparel for a spin.

Designed for dynamic days and individuals always on the move, Jary transitions easily from mornings spent in search of the perfect shot to afternoons on the bike with friends far off the beaten track.

Check out the full drop at PEdALED.

 

﻿﻿﻿

 


Rémy Métailler Rides Portal in Moab

If you’ve ridden Portal, the deadly trail in the Moab area, then watching this has the potential to bring back that feeling of dread you got while hitting some of the sketchy sections! If it sketches out Rémy Métailler, that should say something!

 

﻿﻿﻿

 

Inside Out at Oddity Cycles

We’re slowly uploading our YouTube content back to The Radavist’s YouTube channel, today we’re sharing our Shop Visit to Oddity Cycles video. Check it out for curvy t000bs and one cool d0000d.

See our Inside/Out article here:
Inside/Out at Oddity Cycles: Mastering the Dark Arts of Framebuilding

 

 

Radavision

Stuff we see on the ‘net that causes pause…

Photo by @johnprolly

Golden hour bliss and fleeting light evading John’s lens in the Southern Rockies.

If you’d like your photo featured in our Radar Roundup posts, tag us on Instagram!

author: John Watson
